intro: Bidens campylotheca var. pentamera, commonly known as the five-lobed tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in wetlands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a herbaceous habit with slender stems. Its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, with the ray florets often displaying a yellow-orange color. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in moist environments and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
